Posted By: NeoKoda (9/3/2011 11:33:30 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Vinifera7: The reason they didn't template this with "Add ![Blue or Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=UR&type=symbol)![Blue or Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=UR&type=symbol) to your mana pool." is because it doesn't work that way. Hybrid mana tells you what you can pay for it with, not types of mana to produce. It's the same reason that, for a long time, colorless lands said "T: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool." instead of "T: Add {1} to your mana pool."  
  
In short, it doesn't work within the rules as written, and they decided to make the card more obvious rather than more succinct but have to change rules to get there.
posts.html:
Vinifera7: The reason they didn't template this with "Add to your mana pool." is because it doesn't work that way. Hybrid mana tells you what you can pay for it with, not types of mana to produce. It's the same reason that, for a long time, colorless lands said "T: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool." instead of "T: Add {1} to your mana pool."

In short, it doesn't work within the rules as written, and they decided to make the card more obvious rather than more succinct but have to change rules to get there.

posts.post_content: Not as good as a proper dual land on turn 1, or if you're playing more than two colors. But if you're only playing two colors, you want this more than duals every time after turn 1, 'cause it more or less turns any one of your relevant basic lands into a dual, too!
posts.html:
Not as good as a proper dual land on turn 1, or if you're playing more than two colors. But if you're only playing two colors, you want this more than duals every time after turn 1, 'cause it more or less turns any one of your relevant basic lands into a dual, too!

Posted By: bandswithgoats (12/12/2011 3:07:32 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I like this cycle of land a little more than the M10/Innistrad land. As Alqatrkapa said, this with a mountain for example, may end with ![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol) in your mana pool, unlike almost every other land. Moreover, this comes into play untapped whatever you control a land of the type it matters. If you control a [Shivan Reef](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shivan Reef), this comes into play untapped and you can add ![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol), ![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol), or ![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol) already, but [Sulfur Falls](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sulfur Falls) would come into play tapped, hindering your 2nd turn play... However, it may be only a corner-case, it depends from what you have in your deck.   
  
I like them so much, third best dual land in Modern, after Ravnica shock-land (first) and Zendikar fetch-land (second, even if they don't form a complete cycle, in Modern)  
  
My favourite of the cycle, because I love ![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol)  
4.5/5
posts.html:

Moreover, this comes into play untapped whatever you control a land of the type it matters. If you control a Shivan Reef, this comes into play untapped and you can add , , or already, but Sulfur Falls would come into play tapped, hindering your 2nd turn play... However, it may be only a corner-case, it depends from what you have in your deck.

I like them so much, third best dual land in Modern, after Ravnica shock-land (first) and Zendikar fetch-land (second, even if they don't form a complete cycle, in Modern)
